overview: Zarr is a Python library and file format for storing and managing large, multidimensional arrays efficiently. It provides a flexible and scalable way to store array data in chunks, enabling high-performance data access, compression, and parallel I/O. Zarr is well-suited for handling multi-dimensional array data in scientific computing and data analysis.
core_features: Efficient storage of large multidimensional arrays
Chunk-based storage for parallel I/O and compression
Support for labeled and hierarchically organized arrays
Integrates with NumPy and Dask for array manipulation
